solution_line_template: From each tire repair, he made {tire_repair_charge}-{tire_repair_cost}=$<<{tire_repair_charge}-{tire_repair_cost}={profit_per_tire_repair}>>{profit_per_tire_repair} profit
So repairs made him a profit of {profit_per_tire_repair}*{num_tire_repairs}=$<<{profit_per_tire_repair}*{num_tire_repairs}={total_profit_tire_repairs}>>{total_profit_tire_repairs}
The two complex repairs each made him {complex_repair_charge}-{complex_repair_cost}=$<<{complex_repair_charge}-{complex_repair_cost}={profit_per_complex_repair}>>{profit_per_complex_repair} profit

So his total profit from everything was {total_profit_tire_repairs}+{total_profit_complex_repairs}+{retail_profit}=$<<{total_profit_tire_repairs}+{total_profit_complex_repairs}+{retail_profit}={gross_profit}>>{gross_profit}
So he made a profit of {gross_profit}-{fixed_expenses}=$<<{gross_profit}-{fixed_expenses}={net_profit}>>{net_profit}
